title: Discover the Benefits of Black Rice: Nutrient Packed Superfood
author: Aditya Birla Health Insurance
description: Discover the health benefits of black rice, which was once forbidden to eat. Continue reading to learn all about it.
cleaned_text: Black rice is a dark-colored rice that has several antioxidant properties. Also known as 'forbidden' rice in China, it gets its color from a pigment called anthocyanin. It has a chewy texture and a mildly sweet, nutty flavor with multiple health benefits. You can now find black rice in several cuisines throughout the world. What you need to know: [Historical significance and cultural importance of black rice](#Historical-significance-and-cultural-importance-of-black-rice) [Nutritional profile of black rice](#Nutritional-profile-of-black-rice) [Health benefits of black rice](#Health-benefits-of-black-rice) Historical significance and cultural importance of black rice Black rice has been a part of Asian cuisine for millenniums. The length of these rice can range from long, medium, to very short grains. Black rice was always grown on a much smaller scale, but it is not as common as white, brown or red rice. In ancient times, only wealthy and influential people in China consumed black rice. But now, you can find it in local stores, restaurants and even online. Nutritional profile of black rice Black rice is rich in several nutrients, such as vitamin E, potassium and calcium, that help maintain your body functions. It also contains a fair amount of protein, fiber and iron compared to other rice types. Black rice benefits your amino acid levels, healthy fatty acids and antioxidants. Every 100 grams of black rice contains: - Energy: 356 kcal - Carbs: 75 grams 8.89 grams - Fats: 3.33 grams - Iron: 2.4 grams - Fiber: 2.2 grams Health benefits of black rice Here are some of the black rice benefits that you can get by adding it to your daily diet. - Helps reduce oxidative stress: Besides being rich in several nutrients, black rice possesses anti-inflammatory properties and 23 different antioxidants. These antioxidants are useful body compounds that defend your cells against the harmful effects caused by free radicals, also known as oxidative stress. Unchecked oxidative stress can cause complicated health conditions like heart disease, Alzheimer's, etc. - Improves eye health: Black rice is also very rich in carotenoids (an antioxidant variant), which is very effective for the cells in our eyes, especially retinas. They are also known for reducing the ill effects of UV radiation. As black rice benefits your anthocyanin levels, its vitamin E is crucial for maintaining your skin, eye health and [ immune system. ](https://www.adityabirlacapital.com/healthinsurance/active-together/?s=immune+system) - Boosts heart health: The antioxidant-rich black rice also decreases the risk of heart complications. Black rice contains flavonoids, which are [good for your cholesterol](https://www.adityabirlacapital.com/healthinsurance/active-together/2022/06/13/measure-your-cholesterol-levels-regularly-to-improve-your-heart-health/). In addition, consuming [ 80 milligrams of anthocyanin for 12 day](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19640950/)s can improve your cholesterol levels and [reduce your LDL levels](https://www.adityabirlacapital.com/healthinsurance/active-together/2023/03/15/control-your-cholesterol-know-how-you-can-reduce-ldl-cholesterol-levels/) by a great margin. It is important to remember that black rice benefits your overall health only when you consume it daily.
